name: Falls Resort at Manuel Antonio

reviews.text: The Falls is a small hotel near Manual Antonio in Costa Rica. The rooms are good size and very clean. The garden in the backyard was like a jungle for me. Due to the Costarican climate, the plants are bigger and the vegetation is just amazing. The pool is smal but it was very quite in May so we were almost alone. The hot tub is rather small but again, in the low season, it was perfect. Service was very good, the desk help us to organize a one day guided tour to the Manual Antonio park which was great. The restaurant of the hotel is ggod and there are few other restaurant at walking distance from the hotel. Walk in the area of the hotel is not very since the main road is narrow and there no sidewalk in certain location. Parking at the hotel is small but there was always a parking spot available. There seems to be another parking aside the hotel which was used by the employees. The road noises could be anoying for some people since our room was with street view. It was a very nice stay and the is a grocery store at 5 minutes by car.
reviews.title: Jungle in your back yard

reviews.text: Came here after a family wedding with the entire family, bride and groom. The hotel site was beautiful, tucked away in its own mini jungle. Great pool with infinity edge. Breakfast included was delicious. The eggs and pinto were the best we had all trip - very flavorful. You cannot go wrong with Manuel Antonio beach. Must go to El Avion for dinner or even a few drinks! Breathtaking views. Seriously. Would definitely come back to the hotel. Very romantic! AC was very, very strong.
reviews.title: Gorgeous grounds, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely resort set around rain forest gardens. On the main road from Quepos to close by Manuel antonio. Lots of bars & restaurants close by with a great in house restaurant.
reviews.title: Great for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent four nights here and just loved the relaxing atmosphere and the decor of the rooms were tasteful, rustic and comfortable.
reviews.title: Comfortable and Quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bilingual staff here were very friendly & helpful.
reviews.title: Great Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our reservation was set up by a travel agent and I was very anxious and worried about the hotel after reviewing it on the website - had non-refundable reservations for 5 nights. Well we were pleasantly surprised. The gardens are beautiful and full of birds and sometimes monkeys. There is a nice little swimming pool which I did not see on the website. The rooms (We had a deluxe room) are very nice, spacious and have a lot of storage for longer visits. The items the rooms are lacking are a coffee maker (but they serve coffee starting at 6:30 in the restaurant), a blow dryer (but you can check one out at the front desk and typically keep for the duration), and a phone (who needs one on vacation). The staff were wonderful and very helpful. We loved Luis is the dining room (dinner and late lunches). Also Jockson in the kitchen! Always smiling and saying hello. The front desk folks were outstanding too. We had the best time out of 4 cities in Manual Antonio - walking distance to many restaurants and Manuel Antonio National Park - we went there just to use the beaches - beautiful.
reviews.title: Photos on website do not do it justice

reviews.text: The food in the restaurant is one of the best values around. Very good food and service. Breakfast, which was included was excellent and cook to order.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem. Don't pass this by!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful rooms! Recently remodeled. Love the walk-in rock shower and oh-so-comfy euro bedding. Great A/C and cable TV. Really, really clean (I appreciate that.) Capuchin monkeys, squirrel monkeys, agouti, and toucans visited the grounds during my stay. Wow! I think Sarah was leaning on the 'wildlife button' in the office. Friendly, helpful staff went above and beyond to make my stay enjoyable (my Spanish is not so great, they helped me A LOT!)
reviews.title: Beautiful garden

reviews.text: Despite its location right on the road to MA, it is very quiet and peaceful once you are inside. The garden is beautiful and you can spot many forms of wildlife in there, especially in the morning. I saw capucin monkeys practically jumping onto the breakfast table before the waiter shooed them away. I spotted JC baselisk, agouti, toucan, and birds just sitting around. Luis, the waiter is very friendly and pleasant. The room itself is comfortable with good shower and bed. My main complain about the rooms is that they do not have opening windows. I didn't want to just keep the doors open as there are no screens. The air gets stale inside after a while, with or without the AC. The other problem with the hotel is their jacuzzi. To be environmentally friendly they say they use a combination of sun and waste heat from the office AC. Well, the idea may be noble, but hot tub it is not. I can't even call it warm tub. It gets only about two degrees above ambient temperature. The flat panel TV and cable was the best we had in the three hotels we stayed in CR. It has several American channels including CNN, ABC and CBS from Miami. The Guanabana smoothie is the best I had.
reviews.title: Perfect place and the best staff ever.

reviews.text: The Falls Resort was a great place to stay while in Costa Rica. Its located in Manuel Antonio. Walking distance from some great restaraunts. The staff at the Falls is by far the best part. They go above and beyond to make sure you feel at home. They were so warm and welcoming. We made sure we went around to say goodbye and give hugs before we left. The jungle in and around the area was beautiful. The wildlife is a must see and hear. The hotel hooked us up the the best tours and adventures we have ever had. We toured the National Park, Zip lined through and over the jungle with Diego and his crew which were the best group of guys to hang out with. We toured a Mangrove with Alex and everytime he spotted an animal or whatever, he was so passionate as if he just seen them for the first time. We repelled down some extremely beautiful and huge water falls with our guide Byron and his partner, whom were extremely professional and a blast to hang with. Both my wife and I never felt unsafe during any of our adventures. We will be coming back hopefully next year to repeat all of our adventures and add a couple more. Thank you all for our wonderful experience at the Falls and Costa Rica. I can see why people love visiting there so much.
reviews.title: Wonderfull bungalow with great garden

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our vacation trip to Manuel Antonio, Costa Rica was made pleasant by our 5 day stay at Falls. We loved the room we stayed. They were very spacious and clean. The best was the privacy the rooms offered. Falls is itself located in a very peaceful location. The wildlife may scare some people but everyone co-exists peacefully. The staff is excellent. They really know the meaning of customer service and the hospitality we experienced made us feel a part of them. They were like family. The bar was great and well stocked. The barman was very friendly and chatty. Their warmth won our hearts. We would definitely come back.
reviews.title: A refreshing, peaceful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights while visiting this part of CR. Excellent choice! I would recommend room #6, it is totally private and feels secluded while being close to the pool and bar. Every detail has been thought of, stone showers, comfy beds, plush bathrobes, a wonderful aroma. Happy hour was excellent, and the staff there was friendly, attentive, and inviting. We happened to be there while the US played CR in futbol, which made for some great memories. We walked to the beach on the first day, about a mile down the road. A bus fare is about 60 cents each way. The restaurant serves quality food, and the breakfasts are excellent. My only regret is we did not stay here longer, but hope to return to give them more of our business one day!
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay while in Manuel Antonio

reviews.text: The Falls is in a great location very close to Manuel Antonio. The staff is helpful and friendly, especially at the bar! Their happy hour is excellent, and well deserved after the activities they'll help you plan during the day. We stayed in room 6, which is a detached room with a hammock on the porch and a lot of privacy. From our front porch we saw birds, lizards, golden faced monkeys and a sloth! The sloth hung out for quite a while one morning. The breakfast was delicious, the pool a great retreat with shaded and sunny spaces, and even the movie selection in the lobby made us feel at home and happy. Go to lunch somewhere with an ocean view, stay here!
reviews.title: Great wildlife right in the gardens!

reviews.text: I have been feeling so guilty for not having written a stellar review for The Falls as it's been too long since we stayed in their garden paradise, but I see they didn't even really need my review as they have been awarded the well deserved Travelers' Choice® 2013 Winner for small hotels.
reviews.title: Perfection in Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We're trying to mark some dreams off of our "bucket list" and the pull of sail fishing was on the top of my husband's list. Our two adult children and I surprised him with a week in Costa Rica for his birthday.
reviews.title: Don't be deceived by the entrance

reviews.text: The Falls hotel in Manuel Antonio costa Rica is a beautiful hotel set in a fabulous garden with a lovely pool. The staff were lovely and were great to our 13 year old and 10 year old daughters. The room was spacious and the whole hotel was clean. The food was good and falls Fries are definately worth a try. Reception was very helpful in booking tours. They lent towels for the beach and dvd's for the room for free.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay in Manuel Antonio

reviews.text: Cute little hotel. Beautiful, lush grounds. Service was good, but nothing amazing. It matched the price which was very reasonable for the area. Within walking distance to restaurants, bank, market, Manuel Antonio Park, and the beach. Walk to Manuel Antonio and the beach was a beautiful walk about a mile downhill, but I recommend taking the bus back up.
reviews.title: Great little hotel in Manuel Antonio

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just stayed here with my boyfriend for 2 nights on our trip to Manuel Antonio. Such a beautiful, peaceful, and relaxing hotel and the staff is so welcoming and accommodating. The bed is extremely comfortable, the shower and bathroom are updated, and the room was very clean. The staff at the hotel is so helpful and told us where to go snorkeling and the must do's/things we had to see in Manuel Antonio. We didn't even end up spending any money on excursions because we could do all the things that they told us to do on our own! If you wake up early enough the Falls Resort IS Manuel Antonio National Park. There are animals everywhere on the property in the mornings at about 6:00 am!
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel and DELICIOUS Restaurant

reviews.text: When you stay here MAKE SURE you eat at the restaurant for dinner!! It is absolutely delicious and was the best meal we had in Manuel Antonio. The Mahi Mahi special and the balsamic chicken were amazing.
reviews.title: An Absolute Gem

reviews.text: The only complaint I have is that if it rains at night... The tin roof with the rain hitting it will absolutely wake you up. It is extremely loud. But the hotel is beautiful and definitely a great value for the cost and I wouldn't let that hold you back! Enjoy!!
reviews.title: Fantastic!

aka: Falls Resort At Manuel Antonio Hotel
description: The Falls Resort at Manuel Antonio, Costa Rica is an amazingly beautiful and tranquil garden and waterfall setting within walking distance of this famous little town's best restaurants and gorgeous beaches. White faced capuchins, sloths, toucans, and the endangered mono titi monkeys frequent the trees overhead, while blue iridescent morpho butterflies and hummingbirds bustle about the garden. Whether you are seeking an adventure of a lifetime or just want to relax in one of the most beautiful places on earth, the Falls Resort may be the perfect place for you.
